member.name: T:PFFileSystemObjects.PFFileEx
member.summary: Class for retrieving and manipulating file information. Class includes support for outputting the contents of the class field to text and XML.

member.param: Attribute to query for.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFFileEx.Encrypt
member.summary: Encrypts a file so that only the account used to encrypt the file can decrypt it.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFFileEx.Decrypt
member.summary: Decrypts a file that was encrypted by the current account using the Encrypt method.

member.summary: Makes file read-write.

member.summary: Hides file.

member.summary: Unhides file.

member.name: T:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection
member.summary: Class is a thin wrapper for the TempFileCollection class of System.CodeDom.Compiler class.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: A path to the temporary directory to use for storing the temporary files.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: A path to the temporary directory to use for storing the temporary files.
true if the temporary files should be kept after use; false if the temporary files should be deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.AddFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the specified file to the collection, using the specified value indicating whether to keep the file after the collection is disposed or when the Delete method is called.
member.param: The name of the file to add to the collection.
true if the file should be kept after use; false if the file should be deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.DeleteFiles
member.summary: The Delete method examines each file in the collection to determine, on an individual basis, whether the file is to be kept or deleted. Files can be explicitly marked to be kept when added to the collection using add methods that take a keepFile parameter. When adding a file to the collection using the AddExtension overload that does not have a keepFile parameter the value of the KeepFiles property is used as the default keep file indicator.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose method for the class.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.KeepFiles
member.summary: Set to false to have temp files deleted when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.Count
member.summary: Number of files in this instance of the temp file collection.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.TempDirectory
member.summary: Gets the temporary directory to store the temporary files in.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.PFTempFileCollection.BasePath
member.summary: Gets the full path to the base file name, without a file name extension, on the temporary directory path, that is used to generate temporary file names for the collection.

member.name: T:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory
member.summary: Class for working with Windows directories (folders).

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.GetDirectorySize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates size in bytes of the directory.
member.param: Path to directory to be sized.
True if you wish to include all subdirectories in the size calculation.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.Compress(System.String)
member.summary: Compresses the folder at the path represented by the current instance of the class. Windows compression is used.
member.remarks: Subdirectories are not included in the compression.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.Compress(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compresses the folder at the path represented by the current instance of the class. Windows compression is used.
member.param: Path to directory to be compressed.
If true, the subdirectories for the directory are included in the compression.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.Uncompress(System.String)
member.summary: Uncompresses the folder at the path represented by the specified directory name. Windows compression is used.
member.param: Path to directory to be uncompressed.
member.remarks: Subdirectories are not included in the uncompression.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.Uncompress(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uncompresses the folder at the path represented by the current instance of the class. Windows compression is used.
member.param: Path to directory to be uncompressed.
If true, the subdirectories for the directory are included in the uncompression.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are copied. For example, *.* search pattern means copy all files. Copy all is the default.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.

If true, contents of output folder or file will be replaced. If false, copy will fail and be recorded as an error. See continueOnError and maxNumError parameters for information on how copy errors are handled.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are copied. For example, *.* search pattern means copy all files. Copy all is the default.

If true, contents of output folder or file will be replaced. If false, copy will fail and be recorded as an error. See continueOnError and maxNumError parameters for information on how copy errors are handled.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.

If true, contents of output folder or file will be replaced. If false, copy will fail and be recorded as an error. See continueOnError and maxNumError parameters for information on how copy errors are handled.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.

If true then last write and create date of the destination files are set to corresponding values of the source files. If false, then default System.IO File.Copy rules apply (modified date is preserved while create date is set to date of file copy).
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are copied. For example, *.* search pattern means copy all files. Copy all is the default.

If true, contents of output folder or file will be replaced. If false, copy will fail and be recorded as an error. See continueOnError and maxNumError parameters for information on how copy errors are handled.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.

If true then last write and create date of the destination files are set to corresponding values of the source files. If false, then default System.IO File.Copy rules apply (modified date is preserved while create date is set to date of file copy).
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XCopy(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Routine to copy the contents of a folder to another location.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be copied.
Full path of the destination folder for the copy operation. Folder will be created if it does not already exist.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are copied. For example, *.* search pattern means copy all files. Copy all is the default.

If true, contents of output folder or file will be replaced. If false, copy will fail and be recorded as an error. See continueOnError and maxNumError parameters for information on how copy errors are handled.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be copied. If false, only the files in the source folder will be copied.

If true then last write and create date of the destination files are set to corresponding values of the source files. If false, then default System.IO File.Copy rules apply (modified date is preserved while create date is set to date of file copy).

If true, the application will attempt to continue if a folder copy operation failed because the source folder or file was unavailable or the destination folder or file could not be created. Default is to continue on error.
Maximum number of copy errors before the routine will terminate and throw an error message. Default is 5.
member.returns: XCopyInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.SyncDirectoryTimestamps(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to set the create and modified folder timestamps in the destination path to be the same as those in the source path.
member.param: Full path of the folder contaning the timestamps to be used in the sync operation.
Full path of the destination folder for the timestamp sync operation.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will have their timestamps synchronized. If false, only the files in the source folder will have their timestamsp synchronized.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.SyncFileTimestamps(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to set the create and modified timestamps for files in the destination path to be the same as those in the source path.
member.param: Full path of the folder contaning file timestamps to be used in the sync operation.
Full path of the destination folder for the file timestamp sync operation.

You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files will have their timestamps synchronized. For example, *.* search pattern means synchronize the timestamps for all files. Synchronize all file timestamps is the default.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will have their file timestamps synchronized. If false, only the files in the source folder will have their timestamsp synchronized.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XDelete(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to delete files. Will override attributes to delete read-only files. Can delete all files and subfolders in the source's directory tree.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be deleted.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be deleted. If false, only the files in the source folder will be deleted.
member.returns: XDeleteInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XDelete(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Routine to delete files. Will override attributes to delete read-only files. Can delete all files and subfolders in the source's directory tree.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be deleted.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are deleted. For example, *.* search pattern means delete all files. Delete all is the default.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be deleted. If false, only the files in the source folder will be deleted.
member.returns: XDeleteInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.XDelete(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Routine to delete files. Will override attributes to delete read-only files. Can delete all files and subfolders in the source's directory tree.
member.param: Full path of the folder to be deleted.
You can specify a Windows style search pattern to limit which files are deleted. For example, *.* search pattern means delete all files. Delete all is the default.
If true, the folder plus all its subfolders will be deleted. If false, only the files in the source folder will be deleted.
If true, the application will attempt to continue if a folder delete operation failed because the source folder or file was unavailable. Default is to continue on error.
Maximum number of delete errors before the routine will terminate and throw an error message. Default is 5.
member.returns: XDeleteInfo structure is returned. See for information on contents of the structure.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.DeleteFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Method to delete files from the specified folder. All files in the folder are deleted. Subfolders and their files are not deleted.
member.param: Path of folder containing files to be deleted.
member.returns: Total number of files that were deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.DeleteFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to delete files from the specified folder. Subfolders are not searched.
member.param: Path of folder containing files to be deleted.
Mask to use when selecting which files to delete. Examples: *.* for all files; *.txt for files with .txt file extension.
member.returns: Total number of files that were deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.DeleteFiles(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to delete files from the specified folder.
member.param: Path of folder containing files to be deleted.
Mask to use when selecting which files to delete. Examples: *.* for all files; *.txt for files with .txt file extension.
Recursively search the subfolder tree to delete files that match the searchPattern.
member.returns: Total number of files that were deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.DeleteSubFolders(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes all subfolders in the specified folderPath. Specified folderPath and any files in it will remain.
member.param: Path to folder to process.
member.returns: Number of subfolders deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.DeleteSubFolders(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes subfolders in the specified folderPath when subfolder name matches searchPattern mask. Specified folderPath and any files in it will remain.
member.param: Path to folder to process.
Mask to specify which subfolders to delete. Specify *.* to specify all subfolders.
member.returns: Number of directory entries deleted.

members.member:
Deletes subfolders in the specified folderPath. Specified folderPath will remain.
Path to folder to process. ///If true, files in the specified folderPath are also deleted. If false, only the subfolders are deleted. Number of directory entries deleted.

Deletes subfolders in the specified folderPath when subfolder name matches searchPattern mask. Specified folderPath will remain.
Path to folder to process. Mask to specify which subfolders to delete. Specify *.* to specify all subfolders. Pattern is also used to determine which files to delete if includeFiles is set to true. ///If true, files in the specified folderPath are also deleted. If false, only the subfolders are deleted. Number of directory entries deleted.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.IsValidPath(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the specified path contains legal Windows file path characters.
member.param: Path to be validated.
member.returns: True if path is a valid Windows path.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.PFDirectory.FolderNamesAreEqual(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method determines if two folder names are equal. If necessary, the method will append a backslash (\) to the folder names.
member.param: First folder name to compare.
Second folder name to compare.
member.returns: True if folder names are equal.
member.remarks: In general, the folder names should include the full paths to the folder.

members.member:
Class to manage adding, extracting and removing entries in a zip file.
///This class requires that the ComponentOne C1.C1Zip component be installed along with the calling application.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Path to the zip archive file.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Path to the zip archive file.
Sets the password to use when adding or retrieving entries from the zip file.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFile(System.String)
member.summary: Compresses file using Zip format.
member.param: Path to file to be zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if file successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: Path names are not stored in the zip file. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file will create an entry called "readme.txt".

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFile(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses file using Zip format.
member.param: Path to file to be zipped.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: Returns true if file successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: By default, path names are not stored in the zip file. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file will create an entry called "readme.txt". The pathLevels parameter allows you to store one or more levels of the path in the entry name. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file with pathLevels=1 will create an entry called "samples\readme.txt".

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compresses file using Zip format.
member.param: Path to file to be zipped.
Name of the new entry as stored in the zip file.
member.returns: Returns true if file successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: By default, entries in the zip file have the same name as the original (uncompressed) file. This method allows you to specify a different name, including a path for example.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFiles(System.String[])
member.summary: Compresses group of files using Zip format.
member.param: Array of file paths to be zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if files successfully added to the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Compresses folder and its subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Path to folder to be zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folder is successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: See AddFolderEx for method that allows for greater control over fromat of entry names in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compresses folder and its subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Path to folder to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
member.returns: Returns true if folder is successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: See AddFolderEx for method that allows for greater control over fromat of entry names in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolder(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compresses folder to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.
member.param: Path to folder to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
If true, subfolders are included in archive. Otherwise only the specified folder is zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folder is successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: Parent path information is not preserved in the archive by this call. Folder path name is not saved. Subfolder path names are saved. See AddFolderEx for method that allows for greater control over fromat of entry names in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolders(System.String[])
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: See AddFoldersEx for method that allows for more control over the organization of the data in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolders(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: See AddFoldersEx for method that allows for more control over the organization of the data in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolders(System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
If true, subfolders are included in archive. Otherwise only the specified folders are zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: See AddFoldersEx for method that allows for more control over the organization of the data in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: All files and subfolders are automatically included. Path levels to include in the zip entry name will be automatically determined based on the number of directory names in the folderName parameter.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
If true, files in subfolders are included in the zip archive.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: All files in the folder and its subfolders are included. Path levels to include in the zip entry name will be automatically determined based on the number of directory names in the folderName parameter.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
If true, files in subfolders are included in the zip archive.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: All files in the folder and its subfolders are included.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: All files in the folder and its subfolders are included. All subfolders are automatically included.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
Search mask to determine which files in folders and subfolders to include. Use *.* to include all files.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: All subfolders are automatically included. Path levels to include in the zip entry name will be automatically determined based on the number of directory names in the folderName parameter.

member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
Search mask to determine which files to include. Use *.* to include all files.
If true, files in subfolders are included in the zip archive.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Path levels to include in the zip entry name will be automatically determined based on the number of directory names in the folderName parameter.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFolderEx(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds files in specified folder to the zip archive.
member.param: Name of folder to archive.
Search mask to determine which files to include. Use *.* to include all files.
If true, files in subfolders are included in the zip archive.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: True if zip process succeeded; otherwise false.

member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.

Mask used to select which files to zip. Use *.* to include all files.
If true, subfolders are included in archive. Otherwise only the specified folders are zipped.

member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
If true, subfolders are included in archive. Otherwise only the specified folders are zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: Numer of folder levels to include in the zip entry name is automatically determined from the paths for each folder name passed in via the foldeNames parameter..

member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.

member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
If true, subfolders are included in archive. Otherwise only the specified folders are zipped.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: All files are included in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFoldersEx(System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive. IncludeSubFolders parameter determines whether or not subfolders are included.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: All files and subfolders are included in the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFoldersEx(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
Mask used to select which files to zip.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: Subfolders are automatically included in the zip file. Numer of folder levels to include in the zip entry name is automatically determined from the paths for each folder name passed in via the foldeNames parameter..

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.AddFoldersEx(System.String[])
member.summary: Compresses group of folders and their subfolders (if any) to the zip archive.
member.param: Array of folder paths to be zipped.
member.returns: Returns true if folders are successfully added to the zip archive.
member.remarks: All files are included. Subfolders are automatically included in the zip file. Numer of folder levels to include in the zip entry name is automatically determined from the paths for each folder name passed in via the foldeNames parameter..

member.summary: Extracts a file from the current zip file.
member.param: Name of the entry to extract.
member.remarks: The entry is extracted to a file in the same folder as the current zip file, with the same name as the entry.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Extract(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a file from the current zip file.

Name and location of the extracted file.

member.summary: Extracts group of entries from zip archive.
member.param: Array of entry names to unzip.
member.returns: Number of entries extracted. Check this to determine if all entries were found in the archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Extract(System.String[],System.String)

member.param: Array of entry names to unzip.
Path to the folder that will contain the entracted entries.
member.returns: Number of entries extracted. Check this to determine if all entries were found in the archive.

member.summary: Extracts group of entries from zip archive.

member.summary: Extracts group of entries from zip archive. Uses wildcard search pattern to select which entries to extract.
member.param: Path to the folder that will contain the entracted entries.
Wildcard pattern that determines which entries to include.
member.returns: Number of entries extracted. Check this to determine if all entries were found in the archive.

member.summary: Unzips all the entries in a zip archive.

member.returns: Returns the number of entries extracted.

member.summary: Unzips all the entries in a zip archive.
member.param: Path to the folder that will contain the entracted entries.
member.returns: Returns the number of entries extracted.
member.remarks: This method uses ExtractAll to process request.

member.summary: Determines whether the collection contains an entry with a given name.
member.param: Name of the entry to look for.
member.returns: True if the collection contains an entry with the given name, false otherwise.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an entry from the zip archive.
member.param: Name of entry to delete.
member.returns: Returns 1 if delete succeeded; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Remove(System.String[])
member.summary: Deletes a group of entries from the zip archive.

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.RemoveAll

member.name: M:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.GetNumberOfPathLevels(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the number of directory levels in the specified file system path.
member.param: Path containing path levels to be counted.
member.returns: Number of levels in the path.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.FileName
member.summary: Path to the zip archive file.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of entries currently in the zip archive.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Entries
member.summary: Returns an array of strings containing the names of the entries in the zip archive.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment associated with the current zip file.

members.member: Gets or sets the compression level to use when adding entries to the zip archive. Higher compression settings create smaller files, but take longer to process. The default setting ZipCompressionLevel.DefaultCompression) provides a good trade-off between compression and speed.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.MemoryThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the largest stream to be compressed in memory.
member.remarks: C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile compresses entries into temporary streams before adding them to the zip file. Entries with fewer than MemoryThreshold bytes are compressed using a temporary memory stream. Entries with more than MemoryThreshold bytes are compressed using a temporary file. You can control the location of the temporary file using the TempFileName property.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.OverwriteHidden
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite hidden files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.OverwriteReadOnly
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite read-only files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.OverwriteSystem
member.summary: Determines whether the component should overwrite system files when extracting entries from the zip file.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.TempFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the temporary file to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: Process creates temporary streams while adding entries to a zip file. These temporary streams can be memory-based or disk-based, depending on the size of the entry and on the setting of the MemoryThreshold property. If a temporary file is used, you can control its location by setting the TempFileName property. If you don't select a path for the temporary file, the zip process will create one automatically using the System.IO.Path.GetTempFileName() method.

member.name: P:PFFileSystemObjects.ZipArchive.UseUtf8Encoding
member.summary: Determines whether file names and comments should be stored in UTF8 format.
member.remarks: The Zip specification does not specify what character encoding to be used for the embedded file names and comments. The original IBM PC character encoding set, commonly referred to as IBM Code Page 437, is supposed to be the only encoding supported. Because of this, some zip utilities will not allow storing file names or comments with Unicode characters. Others do allow it, but those file names and comments may not be read correctly by other utilities. Setting the UseUtf8Encoding to true causes C1Zip to store and retrieve file names and comments using the Utf8 encoding, which allows Unicode characters. The caveat is that Unicode file names may not be read correctly by other zip utilities.
